usefulItems: large zip lock freezer bag, pitcher, refrigerator
title: Chicken and Quinoa Salad

ingredients.content: 1 orange, thin peel only, no pith
24 oz chicken breasts, air-chilled, boneless and skinless (approx. 3-4 breasts)
16 oz red beets, peeled, sliced into half-moons (¼ in.)
6 oz fresh green beans, trimmed and halved
6 oz beet greens, cut into thin ribbons
5 oz goat cheese, crumbled or cut into pieces

preparations.content: Place orange peel, garlic, oregano, salt, peppercorns and chili flakes into mixing bowl and grind <b>7 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add orange juice and honey and mix <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer marinade into a large zip lock bag and add chicken. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make dressing.
Place a pitcher onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in oil and set aside. Place oregano, garlic and salt into mixing bowl and chop <b>7 sec/speed 9<b>.

Add orange juice, vinegar, honey and mustard and blend <b>1 min 30 sec/speed 10<b> while very slowly pouring reserved oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Insert simmering basket into mixing bowl and weigh in quinoa and water and rinse <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.
Place Varoma into position and add marinated chicken. Insert Varoma tray, weigh in beets and beans, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>20-23 min/Varoma/speed 2<b> until chicken is cooked through.
Slice chicken into ¼ inch pieces. Transfer chicken, beets, beans and quinoa into a bowl and toss with beet greens and blackberries. Garnish with goat cheese and serve warm.

hintsAndTricks: To easily slice goat cheese: place in freezer until firm enough to slice, grate or crumble.
